page.title: 01GAZETTEER S.E. LEICESTER
page.content: The whole area is on rising ground south of Leicester.Highest point 94m the site of a windmill.The area is mainly residential, with some substantial residences. There are also recreational facilities, an industrial estate a sewage works and an abattoir. Routeways include_ Roman roads, turnpike roads and a new ring road. The area is cut by London Road, one of the main trunk roads which radiate from the city centre. Oadby and Knighton villages are mentioned in the original Domesday Book. The Leicestershire Golf Course and private sports grounds belonging to the University lie in the area, all on the outskirts of the City. Following the Evington Brook upstream, takes us under Shady Lane, a well known tree lined country road.
